data.title: ZooLights Presented by ComEd and Invesco QQQ
data.meta_description: Tickets Tickets now available! Pricing: Mondays: Free Admission Most weeknights: $7 Fridays, Saturdays, and Premium Dates (November 22, December 31): $10 For group sales over 50 guests, contact zoolightsgroups@lpzoo.org. ZooLights takes place rain or shine. Tickets are transferable through Ticketure....
data.text:
Parking

On busy nights, traffic can become congested and parking may become difficult to find. We encourage you to take the CTA or use a rideshare service if you have the ability to do so.

When the parking lot is full, zoo staff will close the parking lot temporarily to ensure the safety of patrons. The lot will reopen when it is no longer at full capacity. If you are coming on a Friday or Saturday night, please plan your parking in advance.

Find free alternative parking on:

North Cannon Drive

Stockton Drive

North Lincoln Park West

Additional streets around the neighborhood

Find paid alternative parking:

By using SpotHero or ParkWhiz

Along Clark Avenue

Along Lincoln Avenue

In paid parking lots and garages

Tickets

For the smoothest experience and to guarantee entry, please purchase your tickets in advance. Tickets purchased at the gate will still require an email and a full transaction.

For safety reasons, we cannot accept cash at the gates. Guests paying with cash will be escorted to Searle Visitor Center to buy tickets.

If you are giving your tickets to someone else, please transfer your ticket prior to the date of entry. No refunds will be given due to missed dates or lack of parking.

What You Can Bring

Lincoln Park Zoo does not allow outside food or beverages during ZooLights or other special or ticketed events.

Medications and prescriptions are allowed with proper labeling and identification. Staff may ask you to place certain medications in a secured locker in Searle Visitor Center during your visit.
